name: (2-Nitrophenyl)acetonitrile
Reason: 2-Nitrophenyl is a functional group that can significantly increase the melting point due to the presence of a nitro group, which introduces a strong withdrawing group for hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +20 degrees Celsius. The phenyl group also contributes to the melting point due to its ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may add approximately +30 to the melting point due to increased pi-pi interactions and rigidity.
